parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.
Behind, after; back, backwards. From the same as opisthen with enclitic of direction; to the back, i.e. Aback.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
